decks.description: > This collection helps people to connect and get to know each other on a human level and spark a meaningful exchange.
decks.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### In this collection you’ll find questions that you can ask yourself, your friends, colleagues, lovers or family members — they are all safe to discuss with pretty much anyone. #####

> 1. Decide who goes first. Tap **Play** 
> 2. The first person reads the question out loud and shares their answer with the rest.
> 3. After their answer, the person choses who goes next and passes them phone. The next person swipes the card to reveal the next question, and the gameplay repeats itself.

decks.description: > Effortless questions to move beyond small talk and kick off authentic, engaging conversations.
decks.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### This collection is designed to spark deep conversations and fun activities to strengthen the relationship. #####

> 1. Decide who of you goes first. Tap **Play** 
> 2. The first person reads the question, reflects for a moment, and shares their thoughts.
> 3. After hearing answering, as a listener, you are encouraged to ask a follow-up question to dive deeper.
> 4. And so you go taking turns... 

 ###### **Pro Tip:** End the game by reflecting on one action each of you can take to strengthen the relationship. ######

Do you have a favorite childhood memory you'd like to share?

decks.description: > Effortless questions to move beyond small talk and kick off authentic, engaging conversations.
decks.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### In this collection, you\'ll find fun and easy questions to start conversations and move beyond small talk. Whether you\'re with friends, colleagues, or meeting someone new, these questions make every interaction a little more exciting! #####

> 1. Decide who goes first. Tap **Play** 
> 2. The first person picks someone to answer the question and hands them the phone. That person shares their answer with the group.
> 3. After answering, the person who just spoke selects the next question and chooses someone else to answer. The gameplay continues until everyone has had a turn.

 ###### **Pro Tip:** If an Action Card appears, everyone must do the action written on the card. ######

decks.description: > Thought-provoking prompts for those ready to open up and share a bit more of their story.
decks.rules:
### How to play ###
##### This deck is for those who are ready to open up and share a bit more. Dive into honest and vulnerable conversations with friends, partners, or family. #####

> 1. Decide who goes first. Tap **Play.**
> 2. The first person reads the question and answers as honestly as they feel comfortable.
> 3. After answering, they can either:
>    + Pass the next turn to anyone, or 
>     + Use the **Switch It** card to make someone else answer the same question before continuing. 

 ###### **Pro Tip:** Use the **Challenge Card** to push yourself or someone else to reveal more or complete a fun task! ######

cards.text: What's a belief you've recently changed your mind about?
What's a realization about yourself that surprised you?
When you think of love, what's the first memory that comes to mind?
What's something you've done that you wish you could undo?
What experience has humbled you the most?
What's an embarrassing moment you can laugh about now?
What's a habit you have that others might find strange?
What was a turning point in your life?
How would you rate your self-esteem on a scale of 1-10, and why?
What's something you're currently obsessed with?
What's a piece of advice that changed your perspective?
What's your biggest internal struggle right now?
Switch It Card
cards.subText: Use the Switch It card to make someone else answer the same question before continuing.

cards.text: What's a memory you cherish but rarely share?
What's a small act of kindness you regularly perform?
How are you really doing? Be honest.
What's something you're afraid to let go of?
What's a common misconception people have about you?
What boundaries do you have that others often misunderstand?
What excuses do you make that hold you back?
How do you think your younger self would view you now?
What keeps you going during tough times?
What's your deepest source of motivation?
What's an embarrassing habit you can't seem to break?
What's a simple pleasure that always brings you joy?
Switch It Card
cards.subText: Use the Switch It card to make someone else answer the same question before continuing.

cards.text: What's the most valuable lesson life has taught you so far?
What's something you're certain about in life?
What's a secret you keep that you think others would judge you for?
What's a mistake you're grateful for making?
What thought keeps you up at night?
What's a fear you've never told anyone about?
When was the last time you felt truly vulnerable?
What's a dream you've given up on?
What's something you pretend to understand but actually don't?
When have you felt the most out of place?
What's a compliment you've received that you didn't believe?
What's a belief you hold that most people disagree with?
Switch It Card
cards.subText: Use the Switch It card to make someone else answer the same question before continuing.

cards.text: When was the last time you felt truly seen by someone?

What's a secret talent you have that few people know about?

Switch It Card
cards.subText: Use the Switch It card to make someone else answer the same question before continuing.

decks.description: > Honest and heartfelt questions about the most meaningful aspects of your life, designed to inspire real talk.
decks.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### This collection is all about exploring life’s most meaningful topics. Expect heartfelt, honest conversations that connect on a deeper level. #####

> 1. Decide who goes first. Tap **Play.**
> 2. The first person reads the question, reflects for a moment, and shares their thoughts.
> 3. After answering, the group can ask one follow-up question to dive deeper.
> 4. The answering player then selects someone to go next and passes them the phone. 

 ###### **Pro Tip:** If an **All Play Card** appears, everyone answers the same question for a group discussion. ######

cards.text: What existential question has haunted you since childhood?
What self-imposed limitations are holding you back from true happiness?
Describe a moment when you felt completely broken. How did you rebuild?
If you could redesign society, what would be your top priority?
Describe an encounter with a stranger that profoundly impacted your life.
What emotional baggage are you struggling to let go of?
Do you feel like you're living authentically? Why or why not?
Share a photo that captures a pivotal moment in your life and explain its significance.
What internal battles are you fighting that no one knows about?
What unresolved conflict keeps resurfacing in your life?
What recurring thought or feeling do you can't seem to shake?
Describe your most painful heartbreak. How did it shape you?
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: What's a transformative experience you wish you could relive?
What do you owe to your future self?
What's a philosophical question you've never found a satisfactory answer to?
How has past trauma influenced your current relationships and decisions?
Describe your darkest moment. How did it contribute to your personal growth?
What abandoned dream still haunts you?
In what environment or situation do you feel most authentic?
What risks do you regret not taking?
Describe a moment of pure joy in your life. How does reflecting on it make you feel now?
How often do you answer honestly when someone asks how you're doing?
If you could unburden yourself of one thing, what would it be?
What's the most difficult goodbye you've ever had to say?
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: How has generational trauma affected your life and choices?
What's the most soul-crushing thing someone has ever said to you?
What negative traits or habits are you afraid of passing on to future generations?
Describe a risk you took that fundamentally changed your life for the better.
What part of yourself do you feel you've lost over the years?
How has your definition of love evolved throughout your life?
What's a belief you hold that you wish wasn't true?
Describe a moment when you felt completely at peace with the universe.
What's the biggest compromise you've made in life? Do you regret it?
How has your relationship with your parents shaped your worldview?
What's a truth about yourself that you've only recently accepted?
Describe a time when you felt completely misunderstood by those closest to you.
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: What's a life-changing decision you made that others didn't support?
How has your perception of success and failure changed over time?
What's a childhood wound that still affects your adult relationships?
Describe a moment when you felt completely alone in the world.
What's a personal truth you're afraid to admit to others?
How has your understanding of mortality evolved as you've grown older?
What's a belief you held strongly that you later realized was completely wrong?
Describe a time when you had to choose between your values and your desires.
What's the most profound lesson you've learned from a failure?
How has your definition of happiness changed throughout your life?
What's a part of your identity that you struggle to accept?
Describe a moment when you felt completely out of control in your life.
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: What's a recurring pattern in your life that you're trying to break?
How has your understanding of love been shaped by your past relationships?
What's a truth about the world that you find difficult to accept?
Describe a time when you had to completely reinvent yourself.
What's a fear that's holding you back from living your ideal life?
How has your relationship with your body changed over time?
What legacy do you wish to leave behind?
What steps are you taking to align your life with your purpose?
What activities bring you a sense of fulfillment?
How has your understanding of forgiveness evolved over time?
If you could save five people by causing harm to one, would you do it?
Describe a time when you had to choose between your happiness and someone else's.
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: What's a personal truth that you've only recently discovered about yourself?
How has your relationship with spirituality or religion evolved over your lifetime?
What's a decision you made that you wish you could go back and change?
Describe a moment when you felt completely disconnected from your own identity.
What's a personal value that you've compromised and later regretted?
How has your understanding of your own mortality influenced your life choices?
What's a recurring dream or nightmare that you think holds deeper meaning?
Describe a time when you had to confront a hard truth about yourself.
If a close friend confides in you about committing a minor crime, do you report it to the authorities or keep their secret?
How has your definition of 'home' changed throughout your life?
What's a belief about relationships that you've had to unlearn?
Would you pursue a career path you're passionate about, even if it disappoints your family?
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: What's a part of your cultural or family heritage that you struggle with?
How has your relationship with success and failure evolved over time?
What's a personal goal that you're afraid to admit to others?
Describe a time when you had to choose between your personal growth and stability.
What's a fear about your future that keeps you up at night?
How has your understanding of self-worth changed throughout your life?
What's a personal truth that you're still learning to accept?
Describe a moment when you felt completely at odds with societal expectations.
What's a part of your identity that you feel is misunderstood by others?
How has your relationship with your own emotions changed over time?
What's a belief about the world that you wish wasn't true?
Describe a time when you had to confront your own prejudices or biases.
All Play Card
cards.subText: Everyone answers the same question for a group discussion.

cards.text: If you develop feelings for a friend's ex, is it ethical to pursue a relationship with them?
How has your understanding of love and companionship evolved as you've grown older?
How do you handle a situation where a person confesses romantic feelings you don't share?
Describe a moment when you felt truly aligned with your life's purpose.
What's a fear about your relationships that you struggle to overcome?
How has your definition of personal freedom changed throughout your life?
When noticing a friend's harmful behavior, should you offer advice even if they didn't ask?
Describe a time when you had to choose between your personal values and societal norms.
What's an aspect of your personality that you feel contradicts your core self?
How has your relationship with your own vulnerability changed over time?
What's a belief about success that you've had to redefine for yourself?
Describe a moment when you felt completely transformed by an experience.
Do you feel compelled to give gifts of equal value to those you receive?
How has your understanding of what gives life meaning evolved over time?
Should you feel obligated to lend money to friends or family in need?

decks.description: > Simple yet impactful questions crafted to spark meaningful exchanges with kids and nurture connection.
decks.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### This deck is designed for meaningful conversations with kids! The questions are simple, fun, and perfect for bonding with little ones. #####

> 1. Decide who goes first. Tap **Play.**
> 2. Pick a question together, reading it out loud, and letting the child say if it is a good question first.
> 3. Offer the child to answer it first, but be ready to answer it first yourself, if the child prefers that.
> 4. After the child’s response, the grown up answers the same question to model sharing.
> 5. If a **Challenge Card** appears, everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

 ###### **Pro Tip:** Keep it playful! Award stars for creative answers and completed challenges. ######

cards.text: What's something that makes you feel brave?
What makes you feel loved?
What's something you're looking forward to?
What makes you feel safe?
When do you feel most creative?
What's something that makes you feel grown-up?
What helps you feel confident?
When do you feel most playful?
What's something you want to get better at?
What does love feel like to you?
What do you think happens when people die?
What do you wonder about the world?
Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: What does being kind mean to you?
What do you think makes our family unique?
What do you think friendship really means?
What do you think is the most important thing in life?
What makes you feel connected to the world?
What do you think about when you're quiet?
What does happiness mean to you?
What do you wonder about yourself?
What do you think is the most important thing about being human?
What do you think about when you look at the stars?
If you could make a new type of robot, what would it do?

Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: If you could design a new type of clothing, what would it be?

Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: What's the most interesting thing about music?
If you could design a new toy, what would it do?
What's the coolest thing you've ever found outside?
If you could design a new type of transportation, what would it be?
What made you laugh the hardest today?
If you could have any superpower, what would it be?
What's the silliest thing you've ever done?
Who's your favorite person in the whole world?
What's your favorite thing about yourself?
If you could be any animal, what would you choose?
What's the most fun game you like to play?
What's something that always makes you smile?
Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: If you could eat one food forever, what would it be?

If you could travel anywhere, where would you go?

Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: If you could teach me anything, what would it be?

cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: What's the most interesting dream you've had?

Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: What's the best adventure you've ever had?

Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

cards.text: What's something you're curious about but haven't figured out yet?

Challenge Card
cards.subText: Everyone does a fun action like drawing their answer, acting it out, or finding an object in the room related to the question.

favourites.exampleText: You have not favourited any questions yet...
favourites.description: > These are all of your favourite questions from all of your decks.
favourites.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### Just enjoy revisiting and finding new depth and insights. ######

screens.title: Human connections beyond the small talk
screens.text: We've built "More Exciting Life" to help people connect with themselves and others with the help of engaging questions and interactive tools.

screens.title:
Connection
starts within
screens.text: Use your Playground to reflect on your journey, train skills and learn something new about yourself.

screens.title: Get closer with others through fun games
screens.text: Get people together, find a space that feels great for you, choose one of the decks and Play!

screens.title: Feel connected to the bigger community
screens.text: Reflect on Question of the day together with others and uncover new thoughts that may help you build a more exciting life.

archive.description: > A reflective journey through the highs, lows, and lessons of the past year, promoting personal growth and closure.
archive.rules:
### How to Play ###
##### Reflect on the highs, lows, and lessons of the past year. Perfect for wrapping up the year with gratitude and introspection. #####

> 1. Decide who goes first. Tap **Play.**
> 2. The first person reads a reflection question and answers it thoughtfully.
> 3. If a **Gratitude Card** appears, pause the game and everyone must share one thing they are grateful for.
> 4. The person answering selects who goes next and passes them the phone.

 ###### **Pro Tip:** End the game by summarizing everyone’s biggest takeaways or highlights from the session! ######

cards.text: What was the most unexpected moment of your year?
What's a small win you're secretly proud of?
What made you laugh the hardest this year?
What's the best compliment you received this year?
What's a new habit you accidentally started this year?
What was your favorite meal of the year?
What song defined your year?
What's a random act of kindness you did this year?
What surprised you most about yourself this year?
What was your go-to comfort activity when stressed?

What was your most memorable day this year?
Gratitude Card
cards.subText: Pause the game and everyone must share one thing they are grateful for.
